Package ca.mcgill.ecse211.project

Class Robot

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.Robot
  • public class Robot
extends java.lang.Object
    Static class that coordinates all actions by using the other resources. Implemented using a state machine to help the pollers determining when they should stop.
    Author:
    Xinyue Chen, Zheng Yu Cui, Alixe Delabrousse, David Kronish, Ariane Leroux
    See Also:
    Software Documentation for more details

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Robot.State
      Enumeration class listing the five states the robot can be in

      • getRobot

        Parameters:

      • initialize

        public static void initialize()
        Initializes the robot's position and imports all the wifi data

        Verifies which team we are and initializes the general parameter in Resources accordingly.

        • Tunnel LL and UR
        • Home LL and UR
        • Search Zone LL and UR

      • toSearch

        public static void toSearch()
        Moves the robot to the search area by taking into consideration the orientation of the bridge and from which entrance it should enter according to the imports from the Wifi class to the Resources class. After exiting the bridge, localizes itself using the lightsensors

        Finds the orientation of the bridge using the deltaX and deltaY of the segment connecting the the centre of the island and the centre of HOME. Although it works for most layouts of the map, the drawback remains that if the regions are marginal, this method only works if one side is longer than the other by no more than 6 units. (Explained in more details in the software document)

        According to the starting corner, determine from which side the robot should approach the bridge.

        • If vertical: approach from lower right OR upper right
        • If horizontal: approach from lower right OR lower left

        After going through the tunnel, the robot light localizes by using the turning on a corner method. The live localization during navigation is then turned off. However, the obstacle detection is on (without cart detection). The robot then moves to the lower left corner of the search zone to begin search.

      • search

        public static void search()
        Search the area for the cart

        Search the area corresponding to the right team to find the cart by going through the middle of the tiles and zigzagging by reaching the end of each row. i.e. Robot goes to the end of every row then moves up by one TILE_SIZE then moves to the end of the second row and so on.

        Reorients the robot so it is perpendicular to the cart (more details at the method orientPerpendicular())

      • toHome

        public static void toHome()
        Goes back home by traveling to the bridge, through the bridge, back to the initial corner, then back to the initial position. Decides on how to go back towards the bridge according to where the initial corner is. Localizes with the light sensors after coming out of the bridge

        Depending if the bridge is vertical or horizontal AND the HOME corner, determine from which side to approach the bridge. The chosen algorithm is moving the robot to the left corner so, lower left or upper right.

      • beeps

        times - number of beeps
